channel.title: GRSciColl on GBIF Data Blog
channel.description: Recent content in GRSciColl on GBIF Data Blog

item.title: Did you know that...?
item.description: This a GBIF API beginners guide. During the first-ever virtual GBIF 2021 Global Nodes Meeting, GBIFS hosted a “game show”: a one-hour “battle of Nodes vs. helpdesk”. The not-so-hidden goal was to demonstrate some of the lesser known functionalities of GBIF.org through a fun, interactive session. The following is a summary of the questions and answers from this session, plus some extras that did not manage to make it into the time frame of the event.

item.title: The GBIF Registry of Scientific Collections (GRSciColl) in 2021
item.description: The GBIF Registry of Scientific Collections, also known as GRSciColl, has been available on GBIF.org since 2019 but it recently got some more attention when we connected it to GBIF occurrences. Now is the perfect time to share a bit of GRSciColl history and what we plan for its future. A brief history of GRSciColl First of all, here are a few facts about GrSciColl today, at the start of 2021:
